intro: Chrysosplenium macrostemon var. shiobarense, commonly known as the Shiobarenses stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces clusters of yellow flowers in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
